Kemal Öksüz

I'm from a seaside town near Balıkesir, Turkey. Currently in Oxford, UK. Passionate about computer vision.

Twitter   G. Scholar LinkedIn Github e-Mail

Me in a Nutshell

I am a Ph.D. candidate at Middle East Technical University in Department of Computer Engineering. Studying under the supervision of Assoc. Prof. Sinan Kalkan and Asst. Prof. Emre Akbaş at Image Lab. I am interested in Computer Vision with a focus on object detection.


I received MSc (2017) degree from Computer Engineering Department, Bogazici University under the supervision of Assoc. Prof. Ali Taylan Cemgil.


I am working for Turkish Armed Forces and living in Riga, Latvia.


Recent News

December 2019 - Our paper, Generating Positive Bounding Boxes for Balanced Training of Object Detectors is accepted to Winter Conference on Applications of Computer Vision (WACV), 2020.
